intro: Microstylis umbelliflora, commonly known as the umbrellaflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its inflorescence consists of an umbel-like arrangement of tiny, white or pale green flowers. Microstylis umbelliflora is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
